item.title: Using Gson to serialize Scala objects
item.description: gson is a pretty nice library that converts Java objects into JSON and back. When using this library from Scala things become a bit harder (eg: Plenty of people have difficulties when their scala object has an (im)mutable Map or List). Here is an example to convert a JSON object to a Map[String,String]: import com.google.gson.Gson import scala.collection.JavaConversions._ val mapJson = "{ 'a': 'b', 'c': 'd' }" val map = new Gson().
